alert.note: Alert for Bronx; Kings (Brooklyn); New York (Manhattan); Northern Nassau; Northern Queens; Richmond (Staten Is.); Southern Nassau; Southern Queens; Southern Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 1:08PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: A wintry mix of sleet, snow and rain will transition to all snow between 100 PM and 200 PM. A brief period of light freezing rain is also possible in a few locations before the changeover to all snow. The snow will be light, reducing visibilities to around 2 miles, and at times as low as 1 mile. Accumulations of up to two inches are possible, and a winter weather advisory remains in effect until 700 PM EST, except for Nassau County. Temperatures around freezing to the mid 30s will continue to fall to the lower to mid 20s by late afternoon. Slippery conditions may develop on untreated surfaces late this afternoon. Northwest winds of 20 to 25 mph will gust at times to 45 to 50 mph. A wind advisory is also in effect until 400 AM EDT. Motorists should exercise extra caution as snow develops and be prepared for rapid changes in visibility.
